page.title: 11Raybould's Farm, Fairfield
page.content: At Raybould's Farm there are lots of varieties of cows. There are Jerseys, Fresians, Charolaise, Ayrshire, Belgian-blues, Aquitaines, British Friesians, Brown Swiss, British Whites, Guernseys, Herefords, Simmentills and Welsh blacks. There is one bull called Philip. There are 10 calves they are Fresians and there is one jersey calf. They milk the mother Jersey. The milking shed is always clean. Most farms have milking machines, but sometimes cows are milked by hand. A piglet weighs less than three pounds when it is born, but grows quickly. At six months it may weigh jas much as 160 pounds.
